question: In the reaction:
$C_{6}H_{5}CN \xrightarrow[(ii)H_{3}O^{+}]{(i)SnCl_{2}+HCl} X \xrightarrow{conc. KOH} Y + Z$
Formation of X, formation of Y and Z are known by:
explanation: 1. The reduction of nitrile ($C_6H_5CN$) to aldehyde ($C_6H_5CHO$, X) using $SnCl_2/HCl$ is the Stephen reaction.
2. The reaction of benzaldehyde (X, which lacks alpha-hydrogens) with conc. KOH to form Benzyl alcohol (Y) and Potassium benzoate (Z) is the Cannizzaro reaction.
